page.title: 17A PUPIL'S DAY IN TOFTWOOD
page.content: My name is Helen Woodward and on a normal school day I get up at 7.00 a.m. and by 7.15 a.m. I am washed and dressed. By 7.30 a.m. I am downstairs cooking breakfast for all the family, normally bacon and egg or boiled egg. At 7.45 I have finished my breakfast of breakfast cereal and my family are eating theirs. At 8.00 a.m. I am ready for school and by 8.15 a.m. I am on a 3 mile journey to school by car from Toftwood to Dereham Northgate High School. I get to school at about 8.30 a.m. and by 8.45 a.m. I am talking to my friends who have arrived. The bell goes at 9.00 a.m. and I line up for 'tutor time' when we read or talk. Next came German, we were in there until just after 9.45 a.m. we started the next chapter of the text book by listening to a tape. By 10.00 a.m we were in science.
